subject: p19389041
History: -year-old female with history of left chest wall chest pain, known lung cancer.
Findings: Frontal and lateral views of the chest are obtained. Left hilar/perihilar opacity corresponds to patients known perihilar mass, better assessed on CT. Old-appearing rib deformities on the left may relate to prior fractures, metastatic disease not excluded, although better evaluated on CT. Extensive vascular calcification is seen projecting over the upper hemithorax bilaterally. No new focal consolidation, pleural effusion, or evidence of pneumothorax is seen.
Impression: Left perihilar opacity corresponding to known pulmonary mass again seen. Otherwise, no acute cardiopulmonary process.
